title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.1: SYSTEM FOR UNIVERSAL HEALTHCOVERAGE

description.narrative: Output 1.1:By 2026, the Government and partners have increased capacity nationally and sub-nationally to provide a better financed, responsive and resilient health system for Universal Health Coverage., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Research, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Digital Transformation, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Risk-Informed Humanitarian And Development Nexus Programming, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1 - Health: By 2026, all children, adolescents and women have equitable access to and use quality, high-impact health services and adopt appropriate healthy life practices.
